dialogues.text: My old man split along time ago.  It doesn't mean anything.  You just take care of number one that's all that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It matters to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay donut.  Whatever you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better get back. Robin looks up to John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really see 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat moves off leaving the lights of Antigua behind. Chuck watches as the island disappears below the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is up and the seas are high.  The ship is under full sail driving at top speed.  Foam sprays from the bow as it slices through the water -- what she was born to do The crew line the starboard rail, thrilled to be part of the performance. Tod is at the wheel with Chris nearby.  The sails tower above him like a mountain of silk.  He wrestles the wheel careful to hold his course against the powerful trade winds. Skipper, making his rounds inspects the heading on the compass and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good sail boys. Tod and Chris beam.  Compliments are rare from this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.  Shall we trim the main Skipper?  I think we could get another knot or two. Skipper turns and looks at Tod, a twinkle in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you like. Gravy.  The two gloat as they lighten the mainsheet tackle.  Phil joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say I have a crack at the wheel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say, fuck off junior. They laugh.  Phil slinks behind the chart house, hurt, an angry.  He spots a spear gun stowed against the chart house. As Tod and Chris pull in the main, it strains and stretches against the powerful wind. Phil aims the spear gun at the mainsail from behind the chart house and silently fires.  There is a wicked POP as the spear punctures the sail, passing through it, followe by a loud shredding as the huge sail splits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!!  Let it out.  Let it out!! The sound brings Skipper onto the deck like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to port!  Hard to port!! Calamity, as Tod cranks the ship into the wind.  The canvas goes limp as the ship hauls to a dead stop.  Peopl dive everywhere to drop sail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the engine.  All ahead full!! Scallop the Square and drop the rest!! He shoots a glare at Tod and Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened Skipper. It just blew out. Skipper turns to the task at hand without a word.  What had been praise is now reduced to embarrassment and confusion. Phil, still hidden behind the chart house returns the spear gun and smiles to himself at Tod's arrogance turned humility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Albatross has dropped anchor along a remote group of flat, lush atolls.  Tall palm trees grow almost to the waters edge.  The crew have the mainsail down and Alice supervises the repair of the sail.  Phil sits above it al sunning himself in the bowswain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from any way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depths of hell... Ohio.  How 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kennet Square, PA.  'Mushroom capital of the world'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to here it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, and it's pretty cool too, ya know?  Bein' here together an all... Phil reels himself down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I'm gonna choke on 'feel good'... Robin looks up, taken back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you such a penis Phil.  Do you do it on purpose or can't you help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug my chain Johnstone. Skipper comes on deck.  Robin and Chuck flip Phil and Terry the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After midterms we'll finish our run down to Curacao. The crew reacts, grumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have arranged to host a good will cruise for the Dutch students of the local school there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Terry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy, rapture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each one of you will be responsible for one student.  I'll expect you to be courteous.  You represent this school and your country.  We'll sail in the morning. George appears from the galley and rings the ships bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's chow. The crew drop what they're doing and stampede down into the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin thrashes in his bunk calling out.  Sweat glistens o his face.  Chuck stumbles out to his bunk with Rick and some of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, wake up.  Wake up! They shake him.  Robin wakes, disoriented, eyes filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was falling... Phil grumbles from his bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, shut up will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a bad dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was so real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the thing; whenever you're having a nightmare, all you have to do is say 1-2-3 wake up!  You'll be out of it.  You'll wake up. Phil rolls over in his bunk trying to go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear to God.  Only good advice he ever gave me.  Now, go back to sleep. He pats Robin on the leg.  The guys return to their bunks Favor Phil, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lingering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay now? Robin stares at the photo of his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how he died you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother.  He fell out of the old beech tree.  Broke his neck.  I was on a camp out.  They started going at it, throwin' things, a real knock down... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't find him 'till the next morning.  They didn't even know why he was up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you never told them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't. Phil stares at the ceiling, affected by what he has overheard.  Someone creeps down the companionway and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you guys, come on! Shuffling in the darkness.  Phil suddenly realizes, he's alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dory hangs from her gallows.  Some of the guys slowly lower her to the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is asleep with a book in his lap.  Mike and Chris slip inside.  The door squeaks, George stirs.  Mike opens a cabinet and removes a fifth of rum. Silently, Mike passes the bottle to Chris who passes it t Tod who passes it to Charlie who drops it down to Robin who stands in the lowered dory with Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing? Startled, Mike and Rick share a look.  Busted.  Phil turn and runs into John, wearing a broad smile, who shakes his head.  No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  Count me out! The crew descend and drag Phil, struggling, into the dory They raise a crude sailing rig and silently move off. A figure stands on top of the chart house, back lit by th moon.  It's Skipper.  Watching it all.  Letting it unfold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper hovers over George, sawing logs.  He tosses a pot on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bolting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  What's happening?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're officer of the watch, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Skip.  It's this damned book.  Lawford gave it to me. The book is "Kafka".  Skipper motions to the empty cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're short one long boat too.  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys sit in a circle around a small fire passing the bottle.  Rick strums his guitar and sings while the rest join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I was walkin' down Lime street one day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Weigh!  Blow the man down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pretty young maiden she happened my way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me some time to blow the man down... Skipper and George crawl to the top of a sand dune and watch the boys.  George starts to stand but Skipper puts hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we know what the next acquisition for the galley is going to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A padlock. On the boys.  Phil is drunkest of them all and does a wil jig as the rest of them sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So to all you sailors who've fought wind and whale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weight!  Hey!  Blow the man down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said "None the better, you all go to hell..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me some time to Blow the man down! They all crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have one question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Canuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're not on the boat, how come the ground is moving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think George'll miss the bottle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll blame it on Big Daddy.  He's a lush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is if that Viking son of a bitch puts me on smegma duty one more time I'm gonna have to run him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Old Man" likes a tight ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "If it moves, shoot it..." The rest join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "If it doesn't move, throw it overboard.  If it's too big to throw overboard, screw it!" More laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Old Thunder Nuts will figure out that we're A.W.O.L. Bill drunkenly imitates the Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "There is nothing that goes on, on this boat that I don't know about. She speaks to me in the night.  So don't test me.  Not even a little..." The boys laugh.  On the dune, George shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immortality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spirits have a way of bringing that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And being sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in a hurry to grow up.  They don't know about consequences or responsibility.  That's being sixteen too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you one thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll know about it in the morning. Skipper smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drunken crew stumble out of the woods onto the beach. As they ready the boat for the trip back Robin looks out to sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ. Tod looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now pork chop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! The guys turn their gaze to the ocean.  The Albatross... is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!  Where'd she go? The crew is suddenly stone sober.  Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone!  The boat's gone!! Phil breaks into sort of a blind panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, oh Jesus.  Man I knew we shouldn't have gone.  I tried to tell you.  I tried to tell you.  You guys made me come!  You made me come!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you shut up?  You sound like my fucking sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Everybody just stay cool. We'll figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell checked the mooring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she pulled free...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they don't know.  If she's adrift, if they're asleep, she could run aground.  She could break up on the reef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you didn't check it good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive, frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.  I swear. Oddly, it's Phil who stands up for Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you're really gonna have some bad dreams if we find out you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell are we gonna get outta here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll think of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, praise the lord. (announcing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax everybody.  Everything is under control.  The jug head's going to think of something. Without warning.  John lunges at Phil.  Phil screams, trying to defend himself.  The guys all dive in.  Suddenl it's an all out brawl. John out of control pounding Phil's head against the seat of the boat. Suddenly, from behind, comes a blistering "THWACK!!" as Chuck breaks an oar over the back of John's head. Stunned, John lets go of Phil and turns, blood dripping from the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody calls me an idiot. He weaves, then passes out, falling face down in the sand The guys stagger to their feet, trying to recover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it man.  I think he broke my nose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Phil. Chuck tosses the broken oar handle, kneels over and vomits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's just great.  Now what are we supposed to do? Chuck and Robin hoist John up and drag him under a palm tree, propping him up.  The others huddle to stay warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew's asleep in the tropical heat of day.  Bloodied and sun burned.  A fly buzzes around Rick's face, waking him.  He sits up sunburned and sore trying to focus.  He gazes across the water, stupefied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-my-god... The others stir and follow his gaze.  The Albatross sits in exactly the spot where they left her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if this is really good or really bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a rod and reel spinning wildly.  George trie to maintain control as the rod nearly jumps out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a live one! Skipper, Alice and Bill watch the shoreline as the boys launch the long boat into the surf.  George is struggling A beautiful tarpon leaps out of the water, but Skipper never takes his eyes off of his boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing about fishing George, is you need to let 'em run some.  Give 'em just enough slack so they don't break the line.  But at the same time you've gotta keep enough tension to wear 'em down, bring 'em in slowly so they don't really know they're hooked. Suddenly George's line goes slack.  He nearly falls over backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try and remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hound dog and hung over, bloodied and burned, the boys stand before Skipper and the others.  Skipper looks dark and angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what a loose cannon is? 'Bout the worst thing that could happen to a wooden ship.  All it took was one, crashing around the deck in a storm... It'd smash everything in its way, maybe take out a mast or punch a hole right through the hull.  Think about it, just one cannon not tied down, not anchored, could take a whole 'Man of War' straight to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't have any cannons? Chris jabs him in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Skipper turns and faces them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if the Skipper were smart, if he could see a storm building, why he'd cut loose every gun on his boat.  Even though it would leave him at a disadvantage in battle, he'd push 'em into the sea.  Better chance running for port than risk the entire ship, his crew. He takes a pause making sure he has their attention for this part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are like that sometimes. They cut loose and before you know it, they're knocking holes in everything.  So you gotta ask yourself if it might not be better to just put 'em off before they sink the whole thing.  I mean after all, you can always get new cannons. He walks back to his place at the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a tight ship, everybody shaved and in clean clothes when we make Curacao.  If it goes well, if your mid terms are acceptable, I may reconsider my decision about the rest of the trip.  That's all. Dejected, the crew goes below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under sail.  Skipper stands at the wheel overseeing the crew taking exams.  Each writes furiously as Alice scribbles problems on the blackboard which hangs from the chart house door. As the boys scratch out the problems, John seems paralyzed.  He looks over at Phil and copies down his answer.  He checks crib notes hidden in his shorts.  Chuc and Robin both see this and exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John makes his way down the narrow corridor towards the head.  Robin follows.  Chuck drops down the aft companionway, intercepting John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To take a piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? John turns around, surprised, sandwiched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right.  You wanna come in and shake it for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're gonna cheat, you might as well copy off somebody who's gonna get the answer right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta be kidding.  Get the fuck outta my way! Chuck throws open the Engine Room door and they shove Joh inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell!!! Chuck manages to pin John.  Robin checks his pockets and comes up with the crib notes.  Chuck lets go.  John snatches them, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takin' a piss? John turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to listen to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do, stupid.  Because if you don't, I'm gonna go right up there and have a heart to heart with Skipper and you'll be on the first plane back to idiotville. John lunges at Chuck, sending them both sprawling.  Robin leaps on top of John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out man!!  Stop it!!!  What's the matter with you?  If Phil had caught you he'd have ratted you out in a second.  You get caught cheating, you'll get kicked off the boat. John explodes, tears flowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cheated to get on the boat!!!  All right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He lets go of Chuck and stands up trying to hide his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doctored my grades so I'd make the cut.  I'm a moron, okay?  You satisfied?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?  Takes me half a day to get through one chapter of Lawford and I still don't have any idea what the hell he's talkin' about.  You know why it takes me so long to write papers?  because I can't spell.  While everybody else is sleeping, I'm in the rack with a flashlight and a dictionary. John chokes back a sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, they even kicked me outa vo- tech 'cause I couldn't read a slide rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can show you how to use a slide rule. The three turn around, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been standing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough. John looks down, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were gonna put me into special- ed this year.  I stole a copy of my transcript, changed all the grades. Shit, who am I kidding.  I'll never pass the boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you don't cheat, and we'll make sure you get the grades.  We'll start a private study group.  Nobody knows.  You'll ace that test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in. They turn and look to Phil, who still shows the tell-tail signs of their fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we believe in you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a blazing sun sizzles into the western sea, the Albatross rounds a point and heads towards the docks several hundred yards away.  On the dock, the students of the school wait.  As soon as the ship is in view, they start to cheer.  Chuck squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make it out? Robin calls up to Phil, who is at the wheelhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Phil... Swing up the 'binocs' and tell us what you see. Phil picks up the binoculars and focuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waving... handkerchiefs or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they're surrendering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second... Phil lowers the binoculars and turns to Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're girls!  They're all girls! Skipper shares a knowing look with Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme those. Tod snatches the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: WHHOOOOAAAAA
dialogues.text: Everyone on board rushes to the port side.  Every single person on the dock is a young girl waving a white handkerchief.  Spontaneous cheers from the boys. As the 'Big A' pulls to the dock, John and Tod run for th gunnel door and swing it open.  The girls flood the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, ladies. They chatter in Dutch and hurry aboard.  Like wall flowers, Robin, Phil and Chuck stand on top of the chart house watching utopia unfold before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we supposed to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta be kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, they don't speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are some things that everybody does in the same language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how are you supposed to make the first move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this! Phil reaches up for a free line.  With a running start he swings out over the water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeeee Haaaaa!! He careens back onto the deck and lands in front of two startled, but impressed girls.  Robin and Chuck applaud. Phil takes a bow.  All hell is breaking loose. Skipper and Alice welcome aboard the headmaster, MS. BOYDE, 50's, dumpy but tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very enthusiastic welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't often have guests.  Our girls have been looking forward to your visit for some time.  Welcome to Curacao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  You're all ready to sail then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they won't be disappointed. A man's voice bellows up from the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahoy there!! Everyone stops and freezes.  Phil turns, disbelieving. It's his parents, Francis and PEGGY BOUTILLIER, standing next to a limousine dressed in brightly colored tourist garb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well.  What do we have here? A floating brothel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly. Francis comes aboard uninvited as usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we thought we'd drop in and see if you were all still in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, of course, we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you never can tell these days, can you? Skipper shoots a look over at Phil who is staring a hole in the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it we can do for you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've come to give our boy a little break from the monotony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not monotonous. Francis flushes red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never the less... He turns and joins Peggy on the dock.  Phil is suddenly full of rage.  This is an invasion of his privacy. Everyone feels it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop to boy.  We haven't got all day. Phil's anger turns to resigned humiliation.  He stops, staring down at his parents.  Skipper puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know, Phil. Phil nods, head down and walks down the ramp.  All watch him go, feeling for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sails begin to rise but unlike earlier, the guys SING out like the Vienna Boys Choir and it's having the desire impressive effect on the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the sun came up there was whisky in the cup/ and not one of us was sober/ Kerry thought she saw a picture, but it really was the sun/ then we knew the party was over... The weather was perfect, brisk and steady under the trade wind swells.  The voices trail away as the ship moves off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curacao seemed out of a dream, somehow make-believe.  But, as Ohio drew further and further away, it was home that began to seem unreal, drifting somewhere in the foggy reaches of our memories.  And I knew that each of us was falling in love. But not only with these wonderful women or the swaying palms and porcelain beaches... We were falling in love with the experience we were sharing, and with who we were becoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew is getting ready for a farewell party.  Each member is primping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bregitta.  Do you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name. (savoring the sound)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bregitta.  It's poetry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as we ship it'll be "forgetta".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind him, Chucky.  You're talking to a guy whose idea of big romance is a palm full of Vaseline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, Valentino.  I haven't seen you swapping spit with anybody. Tod smiles as he slowly pulls something from his pocket. It's a pair of girls' cotton underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I'm discrete, moron. The guys try to wrestle the underwear away from him.  Jus then Skipper descends the companionway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, gentlemen, we sail with the tide.  Twenty-three hundred.  Sharp. I'm not waiting.  Have a good time tonight but be back on time. The crew cheer.  This means the trip goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decorated with colored paper lanterns and streamers, a STEEL DRUM BAND softly plays in the b.g.  The crew slow- dance with their girls, dressed in cotton that seems to glow against their dark skin. Ms. Boyde is scrutinizing the body contact between Chuck and BREGITTA.  Their lips appear pasted together and she doesn't like it.  Lawford sees what is about to happen an hands his slimy cigar to George who reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this, will ya? Lawford intercepts Ms. Boyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam, I would consider it a privilege if you would allow me to take you on a tour of the dance floor. Ms. Boyde is so flattered, it is all she can do to extend her hand.  Lawford leads her away and glares at Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very light on your feet Ms. Boyde.  Was it you who taught all of these young ladies the art of the dance? Ms. Boyde giggles like a school girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil and his parents sit outside at a ritzy restaurant. Phil stares towards the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, you don't like steak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be eating with the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humor me.  Eat it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We missed you.  We wanted to check on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need you spying on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spying?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you put me on this boat in the first place.  I didn't want to come but I did.  Why do you have to embarrass me.  Why can't you just leave me alone? Francis slaps Phil across the face nearly knocking him ou of his chair.  Everyone and everything.  It's humiliating

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis!! She cradles Phil's red face.  He fights the tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you thankless little prick.  We're your parents, so don't you dare talk to me disrespectfully. What the hell is it, this captain? Because I'll see him in a rowboat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has nothing to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what does it have to do with? Us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Look, it's me okay?  Can't it just be about me?  For once? Phil pulls free and exits.  He can feel eyes all over him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice watches, swept up in the nostalgic romance of it all.  Skipper joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would have loved this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All his years at sea, he never stopped talking about these islands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss him. Skipper manages a sad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every hour.  Every minute. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish he was here.  I wish he could have sailed our girl.  Seen these boys... She smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have liked to have said goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am about this. Skipper turns and stares at her deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never would have believed a woman like you existed. Alice smiles and turns back to the dancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the last time you and I danced under the stars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the deck of the Yankee, the night you asked me to marry you.  We weren't much older than they are. The music changes to a calypso waltz.  Skipper takes Alic by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you allow me? She's sixteen again.  There's something about him that still makes her blush. Skipper leads her to the dance floor.  He hesitates, looking deeply into her eyes.  As they begin to dance, th boys notice and exchange looks. Lawford and George sit across the quad, sipping punch and smoking cigars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't know better I'd say the old man was acting almost halfway human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is halfway human. One by one the couples clear for the Skipper and his bride.  They glide, lost in each others arms.  They dance a dance for the ages.  As if it might be for the last time.  The music swells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck and Bregitta, are at the end of the pier, a full moon hangs above the horizon.  Bregitta doesn't understan what Chuck is saying, but it's clear she's enjoying him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember feeling like this about myself, a place, someone like you.  We've come such a long way, seen so much.  But nothing like this. Bregitta smiles and takes Chuck's hand.  He's nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the best at expressing myself.  Maybe the only reason I can now is because I know you don't understand me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you so much.  Too much.  But how could I?  I mean, if we can't even communicate, how could I know you?  It's confusing.  We sail in an hour and I'll never see you again. Bregitta takes Chuck's face gently and kisses him tenderly.  Then, in perfect English...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, too. Chuck's eyes widen, astonished.  Bregitta smiles, takes Chuck by the hand, and leads him to a small covered boat moored to the pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  We don't have much time. Blushing deeply, Chuck follows her into the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin walks down the street hand in hand with one of the girls.  A long string of colored lights illuminate the length of the street.  Robin clumsily tries to kiss the girl.  She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Suddenly there's a flash and the sound of breaking glass. Robin looks up to see Phil staggering, down the street, smashing each of the colored light bulbs with a stick.  H showers himself with broken glass and sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to girl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for me okay.  I'll be right back.  I swear. She smiles sadly and nods.  Robin sprints down the pier and catches up with Phil.  His feet are bleeding.  He is completely smashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil.  What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fandango, Junior. (he holds up his stick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do some limbo baby!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way Phil.  Not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger Meris, steps up, it's a corker down the pipe... THWACK!  He scores another bulb.  Robin jumps out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on man.  Let's just talk about it. The music drifts from the gardens ahead.  Phil bolts. Robin chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil!  Wait man... Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shares a joke with Lawford and George.  The calypso is cranking, but only John hears Phil and Robin crash int the refreshment table.  Robin struggles to stop Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lawford)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back. Lawford nods, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUYS
dialogues.text: John tries to help Robin with Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  What the hell happened to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme go!  Lemme go!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  We gotta get 'im outta here before Skipper sees him like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!! Phil kicks and struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, if you don't calm down, I'm gonna hurt you.  Got it? They drag him into the darkness.  From near the bandstand however, Skipper has seen it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew lean along the rail waving goodbye to the girls who wave back with their white handkerchiefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck and John hold Phil still as Robin picks shards of glass out of his feet.  Phil clenches his jaw, but his eyes are dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is under full-sail driving before a brisk following wind.  It takes two on the helm to keep her safely on course.  Those not on watch are sprawled about the boat, scraping and 'red-leading' or reading.  Chuck and Robin sit forward with John, studying.  Lawford paces the deck, chiding the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rust won't wait for you to read Conrad, Goodall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he shouldn't have written such a long poem, Mr. Lawford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read on, young John.  Read on. College boards are coming. John looks down, dejected.  Suddenly Tod cries from the foretop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they blow!!  There they blow!! Dolphins off the bow!!! Everyone rushes to see.  Dolphins leaping out of the water.  It's a magnificent game they play with ships.  Th crew cheers as each one explodes out of the sea, close enough to touch. Isolated, Phil watches.  Angry, cut off.  Chuck eyes him, worried. Bill and Charlie rig the bowswain's chair and lower Rick into the water.  Suddenly, the dolphins are everywhere. Rick pets them as they swim back and forth.  Shear joy. Phil reaches for the spear gun.  Nobody notices as he loads and takes aim. Suddenly... with a crack, everyone spins around.  A large female dolphin leaps out of the water, bloody foam spraying from her blow hole.  She lets out an agonizing scream.  Phil holds her fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! The crew can only watch, stunned.  Phil is suddenly, defensive as if waking from a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off man.  It's just a fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Phil.  It's a mammal. Skipper steps on deck, sees the dolphin and Phil with the spear gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, lower a long boat.  We'll bring her up with the davit. A dory is lowered with John and Bill inside.  Once near the water they maneuver the struggling dolphin into a canvas harness.  The crew hoist her with the davit tackle swing her inboard, and gently lower her to the deck. They gather around the gasping animal.  Alice checks the wound.  Skipper kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Alice shakes her head and gently strokes the dolphin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's through her lung. Skipper turns to Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phil)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot. Phil looks up at the crew but one by one they look away. Chuck finds this confusing and inexcusable but is the las to look away.  Skipper grimly walks over to one of the deck lockers and pulls out a large wooden mallet and hold it out to Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it. Phil looks at the mallet, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already have.  Now go on.  Do it. Phil backs away.  Skipper stares at him for a moment, the walks over to the dolphin.  Robin looks away.  The sickening sound of the mallet crushing the skull of the animal seems to silence the world.  There are one of two thumps of her tail and, it's over. Skipper tosses the bloody mallet into the locker and approaches Phil, his face flushed with anger.  He grabs the spear gun, and snaps it across his knee and throws th pieces into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?! Phil begins to shake with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  You got so much fight in you; you wanna kill something?  Take your best shot.  The first one's free. Robin holds his ears as if he can make it all go away. For a brief moment Phil looks as if he might take Skipper up on the challenge.  Then the impulse passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're done.  You're going home. Skipper turns.  The humiliation is more than Phil can take.  He lunges after Skipper.  Lawford grabs him.  Phil swings wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean-assed bastard!!  You son of a bitch!!  You can't do this!!!  You can't do this!!!  God damn you!! God damn you!! Lawford leads Phil, struggling, below.  The crew surround the dead dolphin, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Albatross is at anchor in the center of the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil comes on deck from below with his duffel bag. Everyone feels bad but no one knows what to say.  Phil turns to get a second load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regretting it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only hurt yourself you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you really care.  Like any of you give a shit what happens to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who doesn't care, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts too much to care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About anything. Phil turns and disappears down the companionway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't be putting him off the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's been outta control on this trip. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we a crew or not?  I mean, isn't that what this is supposed to be all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the last person who should be whining about being a "crew".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you figure that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd sure like to go into the subject of vertigo and all, but I wouldn't want you to piss yourself. Robin flushes bright red.  John fires a look at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a regular prick you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to the dolphin, Goodall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody deserves a second chance, ya know?  We'd do the same for you Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about family isn't it?  I mean are we together on this or not? There is a long pause.  Mike and Chris cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, do what ever you want.  It won't change anything anyway. Robin exchanges a glance with Chuck and together, they climb up the companionway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck and Robin stand before the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about. Robin turns away, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys were right.  It'll mean nothing coming from me.  He'll listen to you Chuck.  Everybody does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper and Alice have paperwork spread out in front of them.  A knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. Chuck enters, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here on behalf of the crew, sir. Skipper looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, spit it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact is... We'd like you to give Phil another chance. Alice raises her eyebrows, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door.  Sit down. Chuck does as he is told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think I'm sending him home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed the dolphin. Skipper looks at Chuck for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dolphin was a symptom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of a fight he can't win out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his father sir.  He's suffocating him.  We've all seen it... Suddenly it's as if Chuck is talking about his own life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean he has all these expectations and he doesn't even know who his own kid is.  What right did then have to show up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have every right Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They send us because they want us to change, or grow up or something and then they try to keep us the same. Skipper sits up and studies Chuck for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something about Phil's father, and your's too.  How do you think you got here?  You think this is all free, that they owe you something?  You think they enjoy riding subways and commuter trains, driving buses or pulling lobster traps?  Work fifty weeks a year to keep you in tennis shoes and private school?  Look around at how the rest of the world lives Chuck. We're the luckiest people alive, every one of us.  They gave it up for you and Phil, and me too my friend. Chuck chews on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are ground rules in families just like on this boat.  If you and Phil don't like it, I'm sorry. Someday you'll understand that, and if you're lucky, you'll come home and find your best friend has been there all along waiting for you to forgive him for being a father. It'll be the way it used to be, when you were ten and your dad was a giant. Now it's Skipper who is talking about himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Phil know how you guys feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should tell him.  That's something he can take with him. Chuck nods and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chuck exits he meets Robin's eyes.  He shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper returns to his paperwork but can feel Alice watching him.  He senses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all ears. Alice smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not like what you hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've become what you wanted. They're a crew.  That's why he came. Skipper puts a loving hand on Alice's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did we begin this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were idealists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we believed we could make an impact out here.  Self reliance and community through the disciplines of sailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, he's not looking inside.  He's just striking out at the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a lot of hurt inside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he better learn to own it. Actions have consequences. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what happens here Alice, it's what they take away with them. Alice runs her hands across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still an idealist. Skipper turns and slips into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is in the long boat with Skipper, ready to shove off Tension is high.  It's as though they're all waiting for Skipper to give Phil a reprieve.  But, it's not coming. They mumble goodbyes.  Terry and Rick pass down Phil's bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. Phil nods and turns to Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready. Skipper starts to pull the oars to make the crossing to the dock as the crew watches them go.  Robin turns, staring at the ships bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper ties off the boat and Phil hands up his bags.  A black limousine waits, brooding.  Phil climbs up with Skipper and stands, stares at it.  The back door opens, but nobody gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stand, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ol' man's gonna eat him for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what that's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Then, suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god... All stares aloft.  In the rigging, climbing up the mast, is Robin.  With the ships bell in his teeth, he is sweating every rung.  Perspiration glistens on his brow. The crew watches, transfixed as he fights his way towards the foretop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil turns to Skipper.  Working up some courage to say something, anything.  But all that comes out is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. A pause between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Phil. Skipper extends a hand and they shake.  Phil is about to turn, when a familiar sound draws their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin, holding on for dear life at the top of the mast, rings the ships bell triumphantly over his head, waving t Phil.  Victorious.  Ding ding!  Ding ding!  Ding ding! The crew begin to cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil stares back, fighting his emotions.  Slowly he raise his hand in a single wave of acknowledgement.  The ringin stops as his eyes meet Robin's.  Waves back.  Skipper turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never gave up on you, you know. Phil chews on it.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em I said... thanks. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin watches as the limo pulls away.  He rings the bell wildly.  The crew below wave in a show of silent protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Robin rang him out, we waved in silent protest against Skipper's decision.  And in the days that followed the low morale was matched only by a sense of arrogance that perhaps the master should step down and let his students take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin, the Albatross and the drama unfolding below spin slowly away as we climb, turning, higher and higher.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Foam sprays from her bow as the Albatross slices through the swells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tod exits the head with a worried look on his face.  He grabs Chuck by the arm and pulls him aside.  Morale is extremely low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen man, I think I have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pissin' fire man. Chuck reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on Alice.  Pull back to reveal Tod standing in fron of her with his shorts down around his ankles.  Mortified

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice time in Curacao, did you Tod? Alice gets up and moves to her medicine chest.  Tod start to pull up his shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast. She pulls out a menacingly large looking hypodermic needle.  Tod's embarrassment turns to alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stand in line, pissed.  Lawford and George man the deck with Skipper and exchange amused looks.  The doo opens and Chris exits, red faced, rubbing his backside. He glares at Tod who sits on the paint locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way-ta-go Valentino.  I never even copped a feel in Curacao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, your sexual orientation is not my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, is there a social disease you haven't had?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for vestal virgins. Lawford swings up a pair of binoculars.  A vessel under power is coming up fast behind them.  He holds the binocs out to Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make of that? Skipper turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The ship pulls along the port side, keeping a couple hundred yards between them.  The boys move to the rail. George sees them first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  She's got guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's Cuban. Everyone becomes alarmed.  Even Alice looks concerned. Suddenly a puff of smoke discharges from the gun boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: GET DOWN
dialogues.text: The entire crew hit the deck as a shell rockets across th bow exploding in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, we're Americans!!!  We're Americans!!! Skipper grabs the American flag and starts waving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, they're gonna sink us!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill drop everything.  Do it now! The crew scrambles for the rigging, frantically dropping sail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting each word)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell do they think they are? As the sail comes down, the Albatross slows to a stop. The Cubans inch closer and begin speaking over a loud speaker in Spanish.  The seas are high and the two ships rise and fall with the large swells between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want us to identify ourselves. Chuck returns with a bull horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them we're the American School Ship, Albatross. George replies in Spanish over the bull horn.  The Cubans answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think we're carrying Cuban refugees. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper, they mean to board us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a chance.  Remind them that according to the Geneva Convention, firing on a civilian vessel on the high sea is an act of war. Another exchange between George and the Cubans.  The crew lay flat on the deck, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say they are acting on the direct authority of Fidel Castro. Skipper defiantly swings up onto the gunnel rail.  The Cuban Captain gives an order and one of his sailors jumps into the turret of the anti aircraft guns and swivels around pointing both barrels at the Albatross.  Skipper stands firm, between the shrouds.  Silence.  A standoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em to come aboard. George sends the return message.  There is a pause, then the murmurs of the relieved crew.  Skipper swings down bu never takes his eyes off the gunboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to crew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've come a long way gentlemen. But this is no time for heroes.  I know you're much more, but I need you to be boys right now.  That's an order.  Now scatter and find your passports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laundry, books and mementos go flying as each boy scrambles to dig up his passport.  Terry sits among his things, dazed.  Bill notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small launch filled with Cuban soldiers approaches the Albatross.  The crew climb on deck and line up along the Chart House with their passports.  Lawford walks up to Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry left his passport in Curacao. We could hide him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Bring him on deck with the others. The Cubans cast their lines up and climb aboard carrying side arms.  Terry reluctantly joins his crew mates.  The COMMANDING OFFICER faces Skipper as his men go down the line checking the passports.  Others search the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken is a fool's game captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is violating international law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you invited is aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cannons made a compelling argument. One of the Cubans pulls Terry out of line and brings him forward.  He alerts the Commander in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stow away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left his passport in Curacao. It's being mailed to Panama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is unfortunate.  We'll have to take him with us. Terry is petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's a Cuban, Castro wears a dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody aboard my ship is going anywhere. Skipper stares him down.  The Commander signals to one of his men who disappears into the Chart House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps in appreciation for our country's pursuit of peace, you might offer us some, token of gratitude. Skipper doesn't really have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? The Cuban returns from the Chart House with the Ships sextant and hands it to the Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.  And... Pointing to the ships compass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. Without hesitation the Cubans pull the large brass compas from its base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, get the hell off my ship. As they leave the ship, they pause.  The Commander looks back at the Skipper, then deliberately drops both sextant and compass into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll really have something to teach your students now. Skipper stands towering above them.  The Cuban captain smiles up at him.  Amazingly, Skipper addresses him in perfect Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Las estrellas es lo unico, que un marinero verdadero se mesesita para encontrarse.  Verdade Patron? The Cubans stare back, frowning, amazed as they motor away. The crew are stunned by what they have just witnessed. Skipper turns and meets the eyes of admiration, humility and complete respect.  He joins Alice at the helm.  They linger for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say? George smiles, impressed as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told them real sailors need only the stars. With a new attitude, they turn to Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then, let's get outta here. The crew bolt to there positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With staff and string he showed us how to build a sextant.  As we rode the trades, he shared the ancient secrets of how to read the waves and follow stars.  And some mornings later, bathed in the orange glow of a sunrise, Panama rose from the sea like a phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panama appears on the horizon.  The Albatross is dwarfed by the huge freighters moored around her, as she moves through the locks.  The crew stand on deck in quiet reverence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of slumber fill the cabin.  All seems well wit the world.  Suddenly, silhouettes in the darkness.  A hug bearded figure stands in the center of the cabin with a trident in his hand. Chuck wakes with a start.  He bolts upright to see the horrible figure of NEPTUNE himself (Lawford) towering before him.  He tries to scream, but hands cover his mouth.  He is dragged, struggling, up the companionway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Albatross has been transformed into a ghost ship. Where the sails once were, only shredded fabric.  All of the crew have been brought on deck.  Powdered faces glow, surreal. John's head has been shaved into a mohawk.  Robin, Rick and Chris have been reduced to crew cuts.  The shears start over Chuck's head.  Neptune and his sidekick, DAVEY JONES (George) and two MERMAIDS (Bill and Alice) emerge with the rest of the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold fast that polliwog and make him presentable. Chuck struggles as his hair is shaved away and face powdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it be known that on this day in the year nineteen hundred and sixty- one there appeared within the limits of my royal kingdom, the sailing ship brigantine Albatross, bound for Galapagos.  All vessels that sail my domain shall be subject to the scrutiny of the underworld... Terry is brought topside kicking and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence!!! Terry shuts up and succumbs to the same fate as the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight you shall all enter the Order of the Shellbacks.  Only when you have been duly initiated shall you enjoy the mysteries and protection of the trident.  So, let the festivities begin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neptune and his court sit smoking Havana cigars as each member of the crew present themselves.  Robin dressed lik a pig and crawls around snorting. John's an Indian brave, whooping and hollering as he does a rain dance.  Chuck, with flippers on his hands and feet hops around like a frog.  Rick is in 'drag' as Neptune's girlfriend and must sing everything he says.  Charlie is dressed like a sloth and slithers along the deck. Frenetic chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neptune and his court lead a procession around the perimeter of the deck.  The crew follows.  They stamp their feet and chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell is to drift, heaven to steer! Hell is to drift, heaven to steer!! Hell is to drift, heaven to steer!! They move faster and faster around the boat.  They shout louder and louder, faster and faster until they have all worked themselves into a frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey Jones, holds a large turtle shell over the crews heads.  As each one passes before him he pours blood from the turtle shell onto their heads.  It runs down, streaking their floured faces and necks.  As the ritual progresses, Neptune speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By virtue of the power inherited by me, I do hereby command all of my subjects, such as mermaids, sea serpents, dolphins, whales, sharks and turtles, from eating, playing with, or otherwise molesting this vessel or her crew.  Let it be remembered that on this, my Equatorial Domain on Longitude 88' 20' 13" on this 532nd in the year of the dolphin, you entered the Order of the Shellbacks!! The crew cheer and embrace.  Skipper calls from the wheel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Land ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stop their celebrating and gather at the port bow.  Ahead, glowing orange with the dawn, the islands of Galapagos.  It's desolate landscape of silent volcanoes and ancient lava flows that spill into the sea. The faces of the boys, still streaked with the indignitie of the night's ordeal, stand silently before their final destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had journeyed over six thousand miles to the very edge of the earth. Like Darwin before us, we would witness the bliss of nature in the absence of man.  And it was as if the Albatross had forded time, leaving it behind.  In the heat of those equatorial days, on the virgin onyx beaches and shifting coral dunes, one could expect to find sunning iguanas, nesting frigates and perchance... the footprints of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Albatross rests at anchor.  On the beach, the crew watch a huge group of penguins dive and frolic from the ancient guano cliffs.  So unaccustomed are these creature to man, that they have no fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, John and Rick snorkel among the playful SEA LIONS. They dart and swim like otters among their new human friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, Chris, Chuck and Mike stand taking notes on exotic birds.  Frigates, hawks, flamingos, pelicans, boobies, an of course... albatrosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew are sprawled across the deck taking final exams. Alice walks among them.  Chuck throws an anxious look towards John who is buried in his test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boobies nest in the grass.  Thousands of them and amazingly, the crew can walk among them without them batting an eye.  Chuck and Robin watch as the iguanas sneak into unattended nests and steal eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck is alone gazing over the shoreline.  A huge flock o finches darken the sky, circling the black sand beach. Pure magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond, the anchored Albatross rocks and bounces in a blue-sky gale.  Chuck, John, Robin, Rick, Chris and Tod stand by a dory watching the sea build.  They wear only tattered shorts, their hair sun bleached and their skin dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight.  The eyes of predators.  Sharp, cunning, hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone wild goat grazes on the beach.  It looks up, sensing something, unfamiliar, then, returns to it's grazing. Tight.  Thundering bare feet on the black sand. The goat looks up again, this time it sees five Homosapiens bearing down on him.  They come naked, swinging their shredded clothing above their heads like lassos.  Shouting, whooping, primal.  The goat bolts for its life. Pounding through the waterline like the wild horses of Sable, the hunters charge after the hunted, closing.  The goat's eyes are full of a terror it has never known. The beach is broad and long with no cover.  The hunters are gaining on the goat.  Splashing feet pound closer... Suddenly they are upon the goat.  But, instead of attacking it, they just run through it, passing it.  The goat pulls up and stops, breathless, watching the naked humans run. Close on the faces of brothers, matching each other, step for step.  The music builds as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wild eyes behind the charcoal painted masks of primal man The rhythmic beat of sticks clacking and voices chanting. The heaping of driftwood into piles.  Taught and powerful the glistening bodies of young men. Blue sparks leap from striking flint against stone.  A flame is born.  Voices howl in guttural triumph. As the flames leap and singe the darkness, silhouettes of men pound the sand and cry out in a ritualistic dance. The goat watches from the shadows, bemused, as the dance builds to a frenzy.  The night sky is filled with the building sound of raging fire, pounding surf and chanting voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind carries the sounds of ceremony across the water. The flames from the beach reflect off of the water turnin the white hull of the ship, a deep flickering orange.  Th word A-L-B-A-T-R-O-S-S has been spelled in huge flaming letters.  Alice joins Skipper at his place by the rail watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claiming their place in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white surf hisses as it washes among the cinders of the evenings ritual.  The Galapagos have been returned, for now, to the frigates and the iguanas. Across the water against the rising sun, the Albatross, under full sail, is bound for home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stand at their posts.  The yards and foretop are trimmed with sailors, their faces taught and their bodies hard.  No one looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice steps onto the deck from the chart house with paper in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well gentlemen, I have the results of your college board scores.  I think most of you will be pleased. The crew members collect their exams.  Chuck notices John at the bow, alone, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  How'd you do. Chuck looks down at his exam apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? John slowly passes his test to Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a ninety-one!  It's an 'A'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know?  Then why are you up here looking like you're about to jump overboard?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your moment, don't you see? The instant when you know that your life is never going to be the same again.  When you stand up and are counted. John tries to choke back his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't have done it without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you could.  You did. (holding up the exam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all you.  Nobody else. John looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Chuck smiles and joins John's gaze over the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels different doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That we're going back.  I don't want it to end.  I don't want to be what I was when I left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anonymous. Chuck looks at his test grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been getting ninety-sixes my whole life.  It's what they expect. After all this, I still haven't figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured what out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who I am, outside of this boat. What the hell I'm doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you who you are.  You're the glue.  You're the thing that holds everybody around you together. You're strong, you listen and you see things in people the rest of us can't.  It's a gift. It's Chuck's turn to fight emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I never had friends like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like... we can do anything. John smiles, clutching his exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the fading hours of that Pacific dusk, with nothing left to confess, for the first time we felt safe, capable, sure of who we were and where we were going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew sleep in their bunks.  Lawford's voice rumbles down the companionway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wet sheet and a flowing sea/ A wind that follows fast, And fills the white and rushing sail, And bends the gallant mast/ Arise, arise you salty dogs.  The watch is on. Chuck, Tom, John, Terry and Tod roll out.  The dumb waite clatters down from the galley with the morning's breakfast.  Skipper and some of the crew are already eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Albatross is under full sail trying to take advantage of what little wind there is.  The skies are gray and dank.  Tod and Terry are at the helm.  Chuck and John are amid ship.  John relieves Bill on the forward watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're gonna get wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we need it.  I want to take a nice long bath and catch some water for my laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save some for me will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.  I'm going below. Suddenly, a huge lightning bolt explodes out of the sky and strikes the water a hundred feet off of the starboard beam.  Everyone jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!! Skipper bolts onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody okay? The crew nod sheepishly.  A very close call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands keep out of the rigging and stay clear of the masts. The clouds grow dark but no more lighting.  Tod laughs nervously.  Everybody joins in.  It's contagious.  Even Skipper manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right gentlemen.  Thor's had his fun.  Let's keep a keen eye. Skipper starts back into the chart house when suddenly, a powerful gust of wind drives the ship hard to a 45 degree list to the starboard.  Skipper stops and turns. Instinctively, John and Chuck spring for the rigging to drop sail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Stay down!! Skipper stares at the sky with the intensity of a cobra. Waiting.  The wind eases.  It becomes eerily still.  The ship slows and the sails go slack.  Silence.  Skipper maintains his vigil.

dialogues.speaker: WATER
dialogues.text: Foam and spray appear off of the tops of the swells like the invisible footprint of a locomotive.  John sees it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: HERE IT COMES
dialogues.text: Everybody turns and looks.  Skipper's eyes suddenly widen as he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White Squall! The charging wall of wind slams into the topsails so hard it send a shudder throughout the ship.  The wheel is nearly ripped out of Tod's hands.  Instinctively, he trie to turn the ship into the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to starboard!!!  Hard to starboard!!! Confused, panicked, Tod keeps turning to the left, into the wind.  Skipper struggles to get to the wheel but when the ship heals so badly he slides sideways across the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, hard to port!

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT
dialogues.text: Finally, Tod does as he is told.  But as soon as the ship starts to come about, the vicious wind drives her further onto her side.  As the deck becomes vertical Chuck half slips, half tumbles down to the starboard gunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin, Chris, Bill, Mike and Rick are seated at the table finishing breakfast as the ship starts to go.  They all share growing alarm as they watch the table reach it's maximum angle.  Dishes start sliding off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!!  Everybody out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper manages to grab the ax mounted on the chart house and cuts the mainsheet with a single blow.  But it's too late.  The tall masts plunge into the ocean and the sails scoop tons of sea water, pinning the Albatross on her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice struggles towards the door.  The book case tears ou of the wall and strikes her.  She drops to her knees.  Th door swings open in front of her.  She reels for a moment and then loses consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
