dialogues.text: Lawford, Charlie and George are all hurled out of their bunks.  The world is suddenly sideways.  Lawford leaps up pushing the others towards the companionway ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO, GO, GO!!!  TOPSIDE!!!  Come on Charlie!  George, get them out!! George disappears into the main cabin.  Lawford manages t get Charlie out.  As Lawford reaches the top of the ladde sea water explodes through the hatch and drives him back into the bowels of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is through the companionway in the chart house with Mike right behind him.  But instead of exiting, he holds the door open against the sea so that Mike can escape. Mike gets through the door before the rushing sea slams i closed, pinning Robin's arm.  He struggles to push through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slashes at the lines securing the starboard lifeboat with his knife and manages to free it before it is dragge to the bottom.  He scrambles through the collapsed riggin tangled above him for the port lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STERN
dialogues.text: The Albatross is going down.  Fast.  Chuck and Tod stand on the after skylight.  Chuck catches glimpses of the struggle going on below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, they're drowning! Skipper catches a glimpse of Alice through the skylight. Water washes over her but she doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please, no.  Not this woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper's face is pressed hard against the skylight.  His muffled voice penetrates the cabin.  Alice stirs.  She looks around, delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, get up!!  Come on girl!! He pounds uselessly on the teak deck then tears at the planks, fingers bleeding.  Alice looks up confused but calm and finds Skipper's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DECK
dialogues.text: Panicked for the first time in his life Slipper swings th ax wildly at the perpendicular deck sending a shower of splinters into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!!  Get out!!  Jesus Christ, please God, Alice get out!!! But after only two swings, the Albatross and Alice, slip beneath the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water thunders in from every possible exit.  Chris and Rick push Bill towards the dumbwaiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, you go.  We'll be right behind you. Before he can say no, Rick and Chris jam Bill into the tiny shaft.  Suddenly, from below, a tremendous geyser smashes him to the top, knocking him unconscious.  But th pressure is so great that the water sweeps him through th galley and out onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper struggles to reach John and the second life boat but sees that it is tangled in the rigging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, it's not good. John defies him and keeps cutting.  The ship is almost completely submerged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get it! Suddenly one of the deck lockers breaks free and plunges into the water taking lines and rope with it.  John becomes tangled and is dragged into the water.  Only his superior strength allows him to hold onto the lifeboat an keep cutting. The Albatross slips beneath the surface.  Instead of trying to free himself John keeps slashing at the lifeboa lines as he disappears, swallowed by the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie silence.  Lawford is trapped in an tiny air pocket. Debris float around.  He begins to panic as the water around him rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!!  Oh God I'm dying!!! He takes a deep breath and the water consumes him.  Then suddenly, the ceiling above him explodes from the pressur within.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: Lawford is catapulted from the grip of death, to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck continues to frantically dive on the chart house door as the ship takes the 'Deep Six'.  Suddenly the ship rolls 180 degrees, her screws exposed and keel jutting up like a huge dorsal fin.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: Chuck feels the ship coming down on top of him but still finds Robin's arm.  They clasp tightly, but Chuck just can't budge the door.  Then, strangely, Robin releases Chuck's arm and pulls it back through the door.  Chuck looks up, startled.  The small round window in the door i illuminated from the cabin lights on the inside. Through the glass, Chuck meets Robin's frightened eyes. He fights to stay in a shrinking air pocket.  Robin takes a last gulp of air then, a calm comes over him. He meets Chuck's eyes again but this time with a strange acceptance.  They both know what's happening.  But Robin has refused to take his friend to the bottom with him.  H presses his hand to the glass.  Chuck does the same.  The with a smile, Robin pushes himself away from the door, disappearing into the darkness and eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck breaks the surface, gasping for air.  He looks around, frantic.  He sees nothing but the sea swells and debris.  All that remains is the sound of the wind and rain on the water. Suddenly, beneath him, a massive rumbling and explosion o foam.  Then, the tops of twin masts rise out of the water like shattered lances as the ship rights herself underwater.  She holds herself steady for a moment as if in a final attempt at resurrection, the Albatross begins to rise.  Faster and faster, until her entire length explodes out of the water in a mountain of foam and wave.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DECK
dialogues.text: Like Ahab before him, John appears, lashed in a web of tangled line still slashing to free the remaining long boat. And for a moment, it looks as if she might stay there, as if this were just a final surreal lesson of the sea.  Som of the boys begin to cheer prematurely.  But Skipper know better.  She's filled to the gills with sea water. She shutters.  Then, like a stone, she just drops, sucked to the center of the earth, John's hands still slashing, as she finally goes.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Survivors hanging onto the debris that floats in the watery tempest.  Strangely, the wind subsides.  The sea becomes calm and a stunned silence falls over those in th water.

dialogues.speaker: OH GOD
dialogues.text: His scream echoes, for the grief of all.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: There is an explosion of bubbles, and then she slips beneath the waves like a stone.  The stunned crew can onl watch. Then, as if by magic, the second life boat erupts to the surface. Skipper fights off his emotions.  He knows what it means. John died cutting it free. Terry and Bill hang onto a life ring.  Blood runs from Bill's head.  Charlie, Mike and several others hold onto the side of the other freed life boat which has been swamped.  Lawford floats on his back, unconscious, but alive.  Several of the boys help pull him towards the boat. Skipper swims to the second boat, desperately looking for those not accounted for.  But, they are gone. Among the wreckage, the roof of the chart house.  The onl sound left is the ominous tolling of the ship's bell, Robin's bell, still secure in it's fitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats have been floated and tied together.  Skipper i in one, Lawford in the other.  One of the two boats has been rigged with sail.  Skipper stands in the bow staring into the ink blue water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise your sail, Bill.  North, north- east.  Keep a sharp look out for Florida. Bill studies him for a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could wait around a little longer, sir... There is a long pause before Skipper answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone... She's gone. There is something remarkably touching about this young man trying to take care of him.  He puts a hand on Skipper's shoulder.  It almost makes him crack.  He pats Bill's hand gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North, north-east. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Dick, please make a note of our final position. Lawford nods sullenly.  Chuck looks out at the floating wreckage around them, silent, lost. Suddenly, there is a 'thump' on the hull of the boat.  Th survivors share a confused look.  Then it comes again. Chuck looks out at the surface of the water.  It's suddenly alive... With sharks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands and feet inside the boats. They come by the dozens.  Ramming the boats and rummaging through the debris.  They swarm around the boats until it seems as if the water is boiling.  Chuck picks up an oar and starts beating wildly at the sharks.

dialogues.speaker: AAAAHHHH
dialogues.text: The others take up the cause and in a moment they are all screaming and cursing the sharks.  It's a frenzy of grief and anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slashed at the sharks as if striking out at the finger of God. And we all begged silently for the ability to understand what had happened.  But, if there was a God that day, his answer came only in the moaning wind and our questions were left to drift unanswered, in the titanic ocean of our deepest grief. Exhausted, Chuck stops slashing and stares out.  lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up.  Wake up.  1-2-3 wake up. Like Robin's nightmare of his brother, this is all too real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tramp freighter GRAN RIO steams toward the life boats The crew stand silently, watching as the ship approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck stands on the deck of the Gran Rio as the last of the crew scramble up cargo netting hung over the side. Chuck stares out numbly watching as the two deserted long boats drift away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, now dressed, stands in the same spot at the rail, staring out.  A muffled sound pulls Chuck into the present.  He walks slowly down the after deck to a cabin door where sobbing escapes from the other side.  Chuck turns the handle and cracks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curled up on the floor next to his bunk is Skipper.  A look of shock comes over Chuck's face.  Skipper has come completely unglued, sobbing deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper? Skipper turns slowly, looking up.  His eyes are red and his face streaked with tears.  He looks at Chuck almost a if he doesn't know who he is.  Lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I'm so sorry. Chuck reels.  It sounds more like a confession than an outpouring of sadness.  Chuck closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper, back in control, and the crew, stand along the port rail of the Gran Rio.  A small flotilla of pleasure boats surround the ship and hundreds of people line the pier.  It's an intimidating sight.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PIER
dialogues.text: Pensive, worried, angry faces of parents and families. Chaos.  Coast Guard Officials try to hold back the mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the manifest!!  What about my son!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many made it?  Nobody will tell us anything!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a list of survivors yet.  Please stand back.  Don't push! Angry shouts drown him out.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DECK
dialogues.text: The CAPTAIN of the Gran Rio comes down from the bridge with some of his officers and stand with Skipper and the others.  Several COAST GUARD OFFICERS join them on the deck. Skipper turns to the Captain and extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The Captain nods.  Skipper turns to his crew, looking ove them.  A smile of deep pride passes his lips.  They all see it.  Then, between the Coast Guard Officers, he walks down the ramp.  Lawford and the crew fall in behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shouting mob waits for them.  Reporters and spectators shout and call out questions.  It reaches a fever pitch a the crew descend.  Skipper reaches the bottom of the ramp his eyes meet a cool, familiar face.  Francis Boutillier. Phil stands next to him, staring at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (above the shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home. Skipper is shoved forward by the crowd pushing and shoving.  The crew follow but are swept away.  Charlie stops in front of Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil? Flash bulbs explode.  Charlie and the others are descende upon as reporters bark out questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened out there captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many boys did you lose...?  And how come you didn't go down with your ship? Parents begin to realize who has been lost.  Agonizing cries mix with jubilation.  It's emotional chaos.  The crew members are driven apart, they call to each other, suddenly aware of what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!!  Bill!! Terry suddenly finds himself smothered in the arms of his MOTHER.  He strains to see what is happening to his shipmates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sweetheart!  Look at you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper!! Reporters corner them blocking his view.  More reporters clamor after Skipper, who doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, is it true that the ship was hit by a "White Squall"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true the first mate is only fifteen? Bill steps in between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't his fault mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Weather Service says "White Squalls" are a meteorological phenomenon of the imagination. Would you care to comment of that? Don't you have anything to say to these parents?!! The reporter pops a flash picture in Skipper's face. Skipper flies around and knocks the camera to the ground. The reporter jumps back, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.  And it's private.  Very private. Skipper is swept away towards the CUSTOMS BOOTH by COAST GUARD OFFICERS.  Skipper surrenders the manifest and it i stapled to the outside of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper is whisked inside.  The Coast Guard Officers lock the doors behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down Captain.  We'll have a car here in a few minutes.  Can I get you a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. Skipper sits.  The wails of family members can be heard a they see the list outside.  Flash bulbs and faces press against the windows shouting questions.  He just stares a the floor.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: From above we can see the group swarm around the the boot like angry hornets.  The crew are fractured and pulled apart from each other.  Charles, fights his way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck!  Chuck!!! Chuck tries to get to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! They embrace.  Flash bulbs explode all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't bring her down here until I knew you were safe.

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN
dialogues.text: Stands, staring at the empty ramp.  Lost.  A man comes up behind her and leads her away. A reporter shoves a microphone in Chuck's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it the Skipper's fault?  And is it true drinking was permitted on board?  Why did the ship really go down? Charles grabs the guy and shoves him back into the crowd. Chuck strains to see his crew mates but they have been swept away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Charles puts his arm around Chuck, still barefoot, and together, they walk away.  Photographers trail after them popping off a few last photos.  Chuck turns and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNTOWN
dialogues.text: A ride reminiscent of the one Chuck and his father took before the journey began.  There is a gulf of silence between them.  Charles breaks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd find a store, get you fixed up and then get you some lunch.  That sound good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Chuck stares out the window at the traffic and congestion A car in front of them runs a red light.  Charles slams o the brakes.  Chuck is shaken up.  Charles notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, son.  Are you okay? Chuck manages a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lavish and conspicuous by Chuck's recent standards, the store is crowded and jammed with merchandise. Claustrophobic.  Cash registers ring and MUZAK drifts in from above.  Chuck follows as Charles pulls things off of hangers and piles them into Chuck's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go and try some of that on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles peruses the racks.  He calls to Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing in there? Chuck calls from a dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  I'm gonna wander over and look at some shoes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck is curled up in the floor of the tiny booth.  Still dressed in the clothes from the Gran Rio, perspiration beads on his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Tears stream down his face.  He looks up and sees himself in the mirror.  The eyes that look back are eyes of the ages.  Involuntary sobs.  He begins to shake.  The tiny booth suddenly like a crypt.  Tight, with no air.  Chuck lets out a gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Someone pulls open the curtain.  A MAN, from the next booth, fat and middle aged stands before Chuck in a pair of pants still sporting the price tags.  He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, kid? Chuck is suddenly in the throws of a full-on anxiety attack.  He leaps up and pushes past the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck explodes out of the dressing room.  Running, almost blind, he crashes into a rack of clothes.  Charles looks up as he scrambles to his feet and bolts for the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles bursts through the doors, looking up and down the street, but Chuck is... gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The setting sun paints Chuck's face with golden light.  H stares out across the water.  Charles walks up behind him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we were growing up I always felt like you would take care of things, that everything would be okay. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't make this okay, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't. Charles puts his arm around his son.  Together they turn and walk back towards the boardwalk, and the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper sits across from a Coast Guard Officer, TYLER, 60 Tyler pulls out a file and lays it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are allegations questioning your competence with regard to the command of the Albatross.  I have been instructed to convene a formal tribunal to determine whether or not negligence played a part in the sinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask you something? Skipper nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you manage to piss off a guy as powerful as Francis Boutillier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to helm a school ship.  A long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coast Guard 'Eagle'.  She never lost a race while you were Skipper. Tyler is taken aback by Skipper's knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, we didn't.  I miss it sometimes.  But, there are other things a Skipper can do. Tyler removes his glasses and studies Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The families... want your ticket. Turn it in, we forget the whole thing.  Everybody goes home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers are going to eat you alive.  Even if you beat it, you'll never get another commission. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want someone to be accountable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am accountable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard fare.  Two beds and a T.V.  Chuck's lacing a new pair of sneakers.  Charles is in the shower.  There is a knock at the door.  Chuck cracks the door.  It's Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stand by the bulkhead.  Bill tosses down a newspaper.  The headline reads:  INVESTIGATION TO PROBE SCHOOL SHIP TRAGEDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all going to have to testify. They're going to try to take his license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need it to be simple.  They need a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them.  Everybody waiting on that dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell 'em what we know and be done with it.  That's what he'd want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows why she went over Tod.  You jibed the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to get her up wind! That's what you do when you're hit a-beam.  Or maybe you're too stupid to know that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what Skipper thought.  He was trying to spill air from the main!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was coming four points off the bow, Terry.  He never could have gotten her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you on deck?  I was standing right there and all I know is, he... (indicates Tod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... disobeyed an order, twice, and the boat went over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't go over 'til I turned her starboard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an act of God for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an act of stupidity. Tod lunges at Terry.  Bill and Charlie pull them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it my fault we were running all that sail?!  Was it my fault she wasn't dogged down?!!  HUH?!!  I couldn't help that the ballast shifted...!  You son of a bitch!! It wasn't my fault!!  it wasn't. Tod breaks down, sodding on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Tod. Terry drags on a cigarette, then grinds out the butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then whose? Tod looks up along with Bill and Charlie, all confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the lightning strike, we tried to go aloft to drop sail.  We'd done it a thousand times.  We didn't have to wait for an order.  But Skipper called us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the foremast had taken a strike, everyone in the rigging would've been fried.  What would you have done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would have scalloped the squares from the deck.  Right Bill? Bill turns and stares into the water, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, that's right!  Bleed the sails from the deck and she could've taken a hurricane! It's a strong argument.  Even Charlie is troubled by the implication.  There is a long moment of silence between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy.  Nothing could have prevented what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are missing the point. This is all because of Phil.  Phil and his dear old dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think they got this together so fast?  He's been laying for Skipper since the first day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Like he's got a vendetta or some such shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. (to Chuck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you he was a turn coat the day we kicked him off the boat. Chuck frowns, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, the only way to change this is to get Phil to call off his old man.  And that ain't gonna happen.  So the way I see it, it's Skipper or us. The guys react.  It's a no win situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck knocks quietly on the door.  Phil answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it Philip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I'll be in, in a minute. (to Chuck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's saying this whole tribunal is happening because of your father.  Because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's just typical isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true Phil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't there, you don't know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know enough. Chuck puts a hand out to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, please.  It won't change anything.  Tell him to call it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to out there Philip.  Come back in here. Phil meets Chuck's eyes, then looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He turns again and reaches for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Chuck hands him something.  Phil looks down, disbelieving It's the ship's bell.  Robin's bell.  Their symbol of unity, of putting loyalty above fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We figured he'd have wanted you to have it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what you've gotta do Phil. He leaves Phil standing alone on the porch, full of emotion, trying to grasp it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small courtroom.  The room is filled with the crew members and their families, including the parents of the victims, as well as the media.  Phil sits with his father and dodges Chuck's eyes.  Coast Guard Officers Tyler, DOWNING and SANDERS head the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The United States Coast Guard has been asked to conduct this maritime hearing to consider the revocation of Captain Richard Sheldrake's U.S. Master Seaman's Certificate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill sits at the table with his parents as questions are leveled at him.  Chief petty officers Sanders and Downing ask most of the questions as Tyler oversees the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you drop any sail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper called us out of the rigging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your instinct was to lose sail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My instinct was to not get electrocuted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Phil is at the table with Francis.  Sanders asks the questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip, why were you discharged from the Albatross? Phil doesn't look up and speaks in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper thought I was a challenge to authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sheldrake exhibited an arrogant, controlling attitude in my presence on more than one occasion. I believe he had a personality conflict with my son from the start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you don't mind my asking, sir, why did you let your son stay? Francis is stumped for a moment but recovers quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was his dream to go.  I could hardly stand in the way of that, could I? Phil rubs his temples as if he is going to explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Skipper's turn at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true that you forced Robin Weathers to climb the mast when it was clear that he was acrophobic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbed when he was ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you aware that his brother was killed in a fall. Chuck and the others look up astonished.  Mike shoots a look towards Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did it man.  He sang like a bird. Skipper hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I was. Whispers fill the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, were you aware at any time of the use of alcohol among the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't do anything about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I didn't. Again the crew members are struck.  Charlie turns to Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're twisting it all around.  Why doesn't he say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had you ever seen a "White Squall" before this incident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure it was one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really felt that your crew were up for the conditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd come twelve thousand miles together, through every kind of seas imaginable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except, a "White Squall". (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect Captain Sheldrake, they're only boys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are much more than that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true that the reason you expelled Philip Boutillier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For killing a dolphin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and that you invited him to strike you?  To fight it out on the deck of your ship?! Skipper looks over at Francis.  Phil stares at the floor. Skipper manages an ironic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think this is funny?  Some kind of joke?  You lost six people out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (white hot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think one second of this is funny, sir. Skipper stares down Sanders.  He turns to Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no more questions at this time. He turns to sit down, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, one last thing... Isn't true that your father was a sea Captain? Skipper bristles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't also true that his vessel went down off of Nantucket?  Lost everyone on board.  In fair weather no less. Skipper's silence is suddenly filled with rage.  Tyler sees it and tries to intercept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this have to do with anything Mr. Sanders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing.  I was just curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father, was more seaman, more of a man, than you might ever hope to be. Sanders returns to his seat, rattled.  Tyler pounds his gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take a brief recess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew huddle in the parking lot.  Fractured, confused. Chuck, Tod, Charlie and Bill, stand off by themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, don't you see.  Terry's right, I'm the escape hatch.  I disobeyed order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You taking the order wouldn't have changed anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know that. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were the only one's on deck. Look, there's nothing they can do to me right?  I'm a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not the point...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the point... And Skipper'll slip off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Tod is on the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you turn hard to port as the wind hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd have a better chance if I headed into the wind so we could spill air from our sails. Tyler removes his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Captain ordered you hard to starboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you were trained to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you think he was trying to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the blow drive the boat down wind.  Neutralize our canvas. Skipper is becoming uneasy.  He sees what is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when the captain gave you an order contrary to your training, you thought he was making a mistake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why son, why didn't you follow his order? Tod meets Skipper's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because -- I panicked. The room is suddenly buzzing.  Tod's Father stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true Tod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?  What is he doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a gun.  He just sent Skipper a life boat. Tyler turns to Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this young man had responded instantly to your command, do you believe the ship might have been spared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that anything could have prevented what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you trying to say then? Skipper stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can't see what's happening here, but it's clear to me. (to Tod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate what you're trying to do Tod.  Maybe you could live with it, but I couldn't. (to tribunal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think I'm going to let a sixteen year old take responsibility, then you underestimate me.  The Albatross was my ship.  The Ocean Academy was my school.  Her loss is mine and mine alone. (to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't bring your sons back.  If you want my ticket, if that will ease your loss, it's the least I can do.  This... Skipper pulls out his wallet and takes out his license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is easy.  Living with it, that'll be hard. Skipper turns and lays his license down in front of Tyler Then he turns and begins walking towards the back of the room. The room erupts.  Crew members and their families hurl accusations and blame.  Cameras flash.  Tyler tries to regain control.  Suddenly Chuck stands, tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!  Don't you walk away!  Not now.  Not after all of this!!!! Skipper keeps walking.  His head slumps.  Tyler pounds hi gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That enough son!!  Order!!  Please!! Tears begin to stream down Chuck's face.  His father, Charles, slowly stands meeting his sons eyes.  Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Skipper, was it all just a lie?  "Where we go one, we go all". We listened to you.  We believed it. And we're still here!! Skipper keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame on you then Skipper.  Shame on you. Skipper reaches for the door.  Suddenly a sound stops him cold in his tracks.  Phil slowly rises.  Tears streaming down his face.  Tightly in his hands he grips the ships bell.  Ding ding.  Ding ding.  Ding ding.  It is the ringing of the truth.  The tolling of their unity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down! Phil ignores him.  Skipper slowly walks over, his eyes never leaving Phil's.  He stops, facing him.  He gently takes his hands and silences the bell.  Then he smiles an puts a hand on the back of Phil's head fighting his own emotions.  He turns to Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them the truth.  Make them understand. The room grows silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell them Chuck. Chuck suddenly feels the eyes of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's simple.  Bad things happen sometimes.  It wasn't Skipper or Tod.  It was all of us.  Everyone in this room.  Because we all knew the risks. (to parents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent us... You paid our tuition, you allowed us to go.  So to invent a reason for why this happened, to pin it on one person, well that won't change anything.  It'll just make our experience meaningless. He turns to the tribunal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to judge this man, judge him by his crew.  Judge him by Alice and George.  Chris and John and Robin.  In one way or another each one of them gave their lives saving one of us.  This may sound crazy but the Albatross wasn't just a ship, or even a school.  It was something that we made, that's inside us. That's who Skipper is.  That's what he taught us.  I guess what it really was about was... the privilege of sacrifice. Chuck turns to Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that right? Skipper nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. The room is silent.  Then, a voice.  A golden tenor singing like the wind.  Everyone turns.  It's Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the sun came up, there was whisky in the cup, and not a one of us was sober... One by one the crew members stand and begin to sing. Chuck turns, surprised to see his father rise and stand with him.  Words or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny thought she saw a picture when it really was the sun, then we knew the party was over. They all stand facing Skipper and sing.  The voices build sweeping over everyone like a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my heart is sad, for leaving you today, but I know we'll meet again, when the moon is in the valley and the leafs are on the trees, We will come to clearly in the glen... Skipper meets Chuck's eyes and those of his mates.  Only now is his job finished.  He beams back.  The music swell like an anthem, building, like a swell lifting a small wooden boat over a jagged reef, until it rests safely in the calm waters beyond. The crew come together around Skipper one last time.  The embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Older Chuck has returned to the small building where the funeral services were held earlier.  The people have gone but the funeral urn remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck walks to the dock.  He has the funeral urn in his hands.  He steps aboard a small sailboat and begins untying her.  The HARBOR MASTER notices and steps out of his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing. He walks over to the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right friend, out of the boat. He tries to board the boat but Chuck greets him with the sharp end of a gaffing hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand away. He looks into Chuck's eyes and sees that he means business.  He backs off.  Chucks pushes away and raises the sail.  The harbor master watches, perplexed as the small boat moves off for open water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in the orange glow of the sun, Chuck stands naked against the ivory sail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't take his ticket that day.  But why he never returned to the sea, I'd never know.  Perhaps he hadn't been able to free himself from the anchor of grief that had driven him to his knees aboard the Gran Rio, or that he no longer cared for the solitude and isolation of command without his Alice.  Or maybe it was just that the waves that had spoken to him for so long, had grown silent.  Whatever it was, that thing, it had always troubled me. Because, fate offers up no reasons. And maybe that's what I have traveled these thirty four years to say.  Maybe that is all I really know... And, that one man cared. Chuck turns to the sea and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest easy old salt.  For together again, we'll sail. With a powerful heave, he hurls the Skipper's remains at the sinking sun and into the arms of Neptune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same sunset, but from another time.  Four young men walk along a deserted beach.  A small boat has beached an rocks gently in the shallows.  The boys run up and look a it.  On the stern are painted the words:  BRIGANTINE ALBATROSS. SLOWLY PULL BACK to reveal endless white sand, blue water the young men and the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some time later we learned that one of our long boats had been recovered.  Several young men found it washed up on a nameless beach somewhere on the island of Hispaniola.  No one seemed to know who they were or where they came from, but they seemed to know of the Albatross. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes in my dreams those faceless young men reveal themselves as my lost companions, and on the twilight coral sands of forever, between my slumber and conscious state, we race naked again, so open and in love with those precious moments, running, ever laughing, ever young, ever free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young again, their hair sun bleached and skins brown, Chuck, John, Robin, Rick, Chris and Tod, pound through th surf in a grinning footrace.  Brothers all.  Music builds
